newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican says he was on vacation, not kidnapped.
newsitem.headline: Mexican says he was on vacation, not kidnapped.

text.p: The heir to one of Mexico's most controversial political dynasties, allegedly kidnapped by a clandestine group of peasant activists last week, reappeared on Tuesday, insisting he had only been to Europe on vacation.

Newspapers said Ruben Figueroa Smutny, 30, was ambushed last week in a Mexico City suburb in what they called an attack by members of PROCUP, an outlawed radical party believed to have links with Mexico's Popular Revolutionary Army (EPR).
But Figueroa denied any attack had taken place and said no ransom had been paid to anyone.
Reporters called to a news conference in the cobblestoned suburb of Coyoacan said Figueroa looked red-eyed and exhausted when he faced the news media.
He declined to identify the country or countries he had visited, saying only that he had travelled to Europe. He did not produce any air tickets as proof.

Figueroa's father, Ruben Figueroa Alocer, a former governor of the troubled southern state of Guerrero who resigned in disgrace last year, denied reports that his son had been captured and said he was vacationing abroad.
But his mother, the family lawyer and a number of friends confirmed the kidnapping took place.
In Mexico families often deny such incidents to prevent police intervention and to discourage further kidnap attempts.

Figueroa's father is head of a dynasty that has long been among Mexico's most powerful. He stepped down as governor in 1996 after being accused of playing a role in the massacre of 17 peasants in Guerrero in June 1995.

An attempted coverup by means of a videotape fabricated to prove the police had acted in self-defence caused an outcry after national television broadcast footage showing police placing weapons in the dead peasants' hands.
Figueroa's grandfather, Ruben Figueroa Figueroa, also a former Guerrero governor, was kidnapped by an earlier guerrilla organisation, Lucio Cabanas' Party of the Poor.
